attribution: Library and University Collections, The University of Edinburgh

metadata.value: Detail of bindings from a copy of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet Dating to 1949, this work is a facsimile of the second quarto of Romeo and Juliet, which was published by T. Creede of London in 1599. This makes the original one of the earliest examples of Shakespearean literature, as it dates to well within the author's own lifetime. Also belonging to Edinburgh university (see shelfmark De.3.73 for images), it was donated between 1626 and 1636 by former student William Drummond, making it part of the university's first literature collection. Sources: http://www.shakespeare-online.com/playanalysis/romeoplayhistory.html (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/information-services/library-museum-gallery/crc/collections/special-collections/rare-books-and-manuscripts/rare-books-directory-section/william-drummond (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.quartos.org/index.html (accessed 24/09/14).
metadata.label: Description

canvases.label: Romeo and Juliet, 1599, Inside front cover & front end paper recto

metadata.value: Inside front cover & front end paper recto
metadata.label: Subset Index

metadata.value: View of the inside front cover of a copy of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet. Dating to 1949, this work is a facsimile of the second quarto of Romeo and Juliet, which was published by T. Creede of London in 1599. This makes the original one of the earliest examples of Shakespearean literature, as it dates to well within the author's own lifetime. Also belonging to Edinburgh university (see shelfmark De.3.73 for images), it was donated between 1626 and 1636 by former student William Drummond, making it part of the university's first literature collection. Sources: http://www.shakespeare-online.com/playanalysis/romeoplayhistory.html (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/information-services/library-museum-gallery/crc/collections/special-collections/rare-books-and-manuscripts/rare-books-directory-section/william-drummond (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.quartos.org/index.html (accessed 24/09/14).

Sources: http://www.shakespeare-online.com/playanalysis/romeoplayhistory.html (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/information-services/library-museum-gallery/crc/collections/special-collections/rare-books-and-manuscripts/rare-books-directory-section/william-drummond (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.quartos.org/index.html (accessed 24/09/14).
